author: Corbin March

comments.comment: Suggested resource; 'Teach Yourself Programming in Ten Years' by Peter Norvig.
Going to tech user groups is a good way to become a more social programmer while learning.

description: Tips for learning and developing as a programmer early in your career.

quotes.quote: Up-to-date knowledge on technology and a willingness to learn make a passionate Junior Developer an incredibly valuable thing, far more than a professed expert who is stuck in their ways.
...new concepts changed the way I thought about my existing tools, which further changed the way I thought about new tools.
Tech user groups are full of people who love to meet face to face, share the projects they’re working on, and talk about ways to improve.
We need to be comfortable starting with the basics and making mistakes. Your first project won’t be as good as those that follow.

title: How I Learned Programming in Ten Short Years, Thanks to Peter Norvig
